page.title: 15A Local Family
page.content: Sir Henry Ed. Bunbury with Admiral Lord Keith had to tell Napoleon that he was to be confined for life on St. Helena. The Bunburys were great friends of Charles James Fox the MP and reformer of the mid C18th The Park and Aboretum (now built on) contained many beautiful trees collected by Lieut. Gen. Sir Henry Bunbury from the Greek Islands the Balkans and Australasia. The earliest record of the name Bunbury is in the original Domesday Book which says - 1086 Robert Fitz Hugh held Bunbury-Beeston. The Bunbury Family now live in East Suffolk.
